	<item>
		<title>For the want of a comma</title>
		<link>http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/07/for-the-want-of-a-comma/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 23 Jul 2010 14:07:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/?p=2554</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[A tale of fantastic tech service from our hosting partner Engine Yard.

Matt was up most of the night with a major code deploy. When he pulled the trigger, one little comma held his success at bay. Tim from Engine Yard noticed that our site was down, took a look at the code and fixed it within about 10 minutes.

Here is the email excerpt:

<strong>From Tim at Engine Yard:
</strong>Hi Tom,
We noticed that your site was down earlier via a site uptime alert. The mongrels on your production environment had died due to a syntax error in your routes.rb file.
<div id="_mcePaste">We fixed the issue by adding a missing comma into the file here (missing on the :signin_error line):</div>
<div id="_mcePaste">Line 292:</div>
<div id="_mcePaste"># User routes to allow disabling default route to check routes</div>
<div id="_mcePaste">map.resource :user, :controller =&gt; "user", :only =&gt; [],</div>
<div id="_mcePaste">:member =&gt; {</div>
<div id="_mcePaste">:signin =&gt; [:get,:post],</div>
<div id="_mcePaste">:signout =&gt; [:get],</div>
<div id="_mcePaste">:signin_error =&gt; [:get],</div>
<div id="_mcePaste">:unauthorized =&gt; [:get],</div>
<div id="_mcePaste">:add_assignment =&gt; [:get,:post]</div>
<div id="_mcePaste">}</div>
<div id="_mcePaste">The site is now back up due to this change, but please make this change in your code before deploying again.</div>
<div id="_mcePaste">Thanks,</div>
<div id="_mcePaste">Tim</div>
<div id="_mcePaste"><strong>My reply:</strong></div>
<div id="_mcePaste">Wow Tim, that is great service! Thanks very much for helping out. Our deploy team was at the end of a very long night and you saved the day. We raise our bacon and eggs to you!</div>
<div id="_mcePaste">Tom</div>
<div></div>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Changing the way quizzes are built</title>
		<link>http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/08/changing-the-way-quizzes-are-built/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 02 Aug 2010 15:01:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/?p=2629</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Problem solved for the folks who thought quizzes should be built from the bottom up.  When adding questions to a quiz, they are inserted at the bottom of the list.  Matt even made the screen zip to the bottom so the newly added question is easily found and edited.

<a rel="attachment wp-att-2663" href="http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/08/changing-the-way-quizzes-are-built/american-national-government-dr-chapman-rackaway-ch-3_-federalism-3-2_-one-state-two-state-red-state-blue-state-2/"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2663" title="American National Government - Dr. Chapman Rackaway &gt; Ch. 3_ Federalism &gt; 3.2_ One State, Two State, Red State, Blue State-2" src="http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/files/2010/07/American-National-Government-Dr.-Chapman-Rackaway-Ch.-3_-Federalism-3.2_-One-State-Two-State-Red-State-Blue-State-2.jpg" alt="" width="513" height="409" /></a>

		<title>Invisible but important</title>
		<link>http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/08/invisible-but-important/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 06 Aug 2010 14:43:38 +0000</pubDate>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/?p=2705</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I can think of a lot of things in life that fall into this category, but today I speak of two admin changes Matt just made.

* The administrator interface shows a student count of the WGU history courses.
* The plumbing that assigns rights to users has been updated to give us more flexibility in the future.
* The problems embedded inside the business stats assignments are now housed at Amazon S3 which makes the whole business stats experience faster.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Bounced checks are bad</title>
		<link>http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/08/bounced-checks-are-bad/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 06 Aug 2010 15:05:03 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/?p=2722</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[If you prod, I might just give you my whole rant on personal responsibility and kids these days. Since you didn't, let me just say that we get a rather high percentage of returned checks - both electronic and paper. As each of those bounced checks results in zero dollars paid and, and! a fee from the bank, we've decided to remove the echeck option from our payment page.<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2724" title="Registration" src="http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/files/2010/08/Registration1.jpg" alt="" width="609" height="191" />

For the student who's personality is so magnetic, they are unable to carry credit cards, we will happily accept a cashiers check or money order.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Link Checker update</title>
		<link>http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/08/link-checker-update/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 06 Aug 2010 20:35:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/?p=2730</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Matt has made some tweaks to the behavior of the link checker.

The bottom line: We check our links every 4 hours. When one breaks, our support group is emailed and they spring to action.

The details under the hood:
Every night our beta server downloads a copy of our live database. The checker scours the database for links in any course that is active and not at Soomo College.
At 3, 7, 11, 15, 19, and 23 00 hours, the links are checked. If any links are found broken, an e-mail is sent to support providing the broken URL and a list of the affected courses.

As links are fixed, they will fall off the list the next time day at midnight. For a variety of reasons, checking thousands of links is a big job for our server. For that reason, we've moved the task to beta (a server we have here in Asheville), allowing our customer facing production site to work at maximum efficiency.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>2730</wp:post_id>

		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-08-06 20:35:39</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>link-checker-update</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>

	<item>
		<title>A peek behind the curtain</title>
		<link>http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/08/a-peek-behind-the-curtain/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 10 Aug 2010 19:08:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/?p=2738</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[A lot of the reports we run are created by a pretty complicated robot dance. Matt gave us a a little peek behind the curtain so we can see the process as it is happening. I sort of wish it looked/smelled/tasted like this:

<a rel="attachment wp-att-2739" href="http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/08/a-peek-behind-the-curtain/krispy-kreme-waterfall-2/"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2739" title="krispy-kreme-waterfall-2" src="http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/files/2010/08/krispy-kreme-waterfall-2.jpg" alt="" width="400" height="269" /></a>

But alas, our robots look more like this:

<a rel="attachment wp-att-2740" href="http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/08/a-peek-behind-the-curtain/http___soomopublishing-com_admin_delayed_jobs_3591/"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2740" title="http___soomopublishing.com_admin_delayed_jobs_3591" src="http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/files/2010/08/http___soomopublishing.com_admin_delayed_jobs_3591.jpg" alt="" width="485" height="233" /></a>

Either way, we get a little more intel on what is happening behind the scenes which always helps us understand the how and why.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>2738</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-08-10 12:08:04</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-08-10 19:08:04</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

	<item>
		<title>Roles</title>
		<link>http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/08/roles/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 10 Aug 2010 21:24:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>matt bennink</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/?p=2748</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The roles in our platform have undergone a few changes. It is best explained with a list and an explanation of each.
<ol>
	<li>Soomo Admin - think in-house with a need to access everything.</li>
	<li>Soomo Editor - in-house with a need to edit content, and have access to all features of the editor and editorial space.</li>
	<li>Editor - a user who needs access to a course solely for the purpose of editing content.</li>
	<li>Instructor - a user who needs access to a course for editing and viewing notebooks.</li>
	<li>Mentor - a user who needs access to a course for viewing the notebook and managing students.</li>
	<li>Grader - a user who needs access to a course for viewing the notebook.</li>
	<li>Student - a user who needs access to a course for viewing content and answering questions.</li>
</ol>
Major changes?
<ol>
	<li>"Admin" became "Soomo Admin" and all previous Admins lost the Admin role.</li>
	<li>"Editor" became "Soomo Editor".</li>
	<li>"Editor" and "Mentor" were added, and are so far unused. They are in place for future WGU development.</li>
</ol>
These roles are adaptable. The goal is for each user to have the proper roles to accomplish his/her work, and nothing more. This protects them and us by limiting access as necessary.

Please comment with any questions or suggestions.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>roles</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>

	<item>
		<title>Password case sensitivity de-sensitized</title>
		<link>http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/09/password-case-sensitivity-de-sensitized/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 24 Sep 2010 14:28:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/?p=2821</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Sometimes students use capital letters in their passwords on purpose - making it harder to crack. Most times, students who use capital letters in their passwords forget and have chronic password problems as a result.

In the interest of reducing their frustration, we have elected to ignore case when evaluating a password. So now "PaSSworD" and "password" areequivalentto our system.  Matt is on the record for pointing out that security took a significant hit when we reduced the complexity of passwords. We'll keep an eye out for nefariousness.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>2821</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>password-case-sensitivity-de-sensitized</wp:post_name>

	<item>
		<title>Archiving the Web</title>
		<link>http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/10/archiving-the-web/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 01 Oct 2010 19:30:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/?p=2872</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Sometimes the internet lets us down - links break, websites go away. Assignments break when they depend on a specific page on the web that takes a hike.  Today starts a long term project to archive the content referenced on our site.

The process goes like this: I visit each assignment that has a pop off link to another site. I save the page(s) as pdf files and keep them in an archive locker. Should the site or page referenced disappear for any reason, we can quickly replace the live link with our archived copy. Pow, we are back in business! Of course, you have surmised that this won't work with every assignment or every link. For the pages that can be archived, we will be ready for anything.

The cached content is referenced in the editorial space.<img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2873" title="Soomo Publishing - Editorial-1" src="http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/files/2010/10/Soomo-Publishing-Editorial-1.jpg" alt="" width="604" height="279" />]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>2872</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-10-01 12:30:23</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-10-01 19:30:23</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>archiving-the-web</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>

	<item>
		<title>Apple Links</title>
		<link>http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/10/apple-links/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 12 Oct 2010 21:46:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>lindrum</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/?p=2923</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Fritz asked me about links to sources of info about Apple and out popped the following list. What am I missing? Any other favored sources out there?

news:  <a href="http://daringfireball.net/">Daring Fireball</a>

profiles of how people mac and why: <a href="http://shawnblanc.net/">Shawn Blanc</a>

tips: <a href="http://mac.finerthingsin.com/">Finer Things in Mac</a>

apps: <a href="http://iphoneapps.oreilly.com/">O'Reilly iPhone Apps</a>

news, reviews and tips: <a href="http://db.tidbits.com/">TidBits</a>

reviews and new stuff, but always in favor of minimal: <a href="http://minimalmac.com/">Minimal Mac</a>

reviews and new stuff: <a href="http://smokingapples.com/">Smoking Apples</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Our new place in Miami</title>
		<link>http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/10/our-new-place-in-miami/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 15 Oct 2010 19:47:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/?p=2945</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Our hosting partner, Engine Yard, has moved our site to their new data center in Miami. Fascinating, I know! When we get a condo on the beach, we get a serious condo.
<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%">
<tbody>
<tr>
<th>Building Features</th>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>750,000 square foot, purpose-built datacenter</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Tier IV facility with N+2 power and cooling infrastructure</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Equipment floors 32 feet above sea level</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Roof slope designed to aid in drainage of floodwater in excess of 100-year storm intensity assisted by 18 rooftop drains</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>Designed to withstand a Category 5 hurricane with approximately 19 million pounds of concrete roof ballast</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>7 inch thick steel reinforced concrete exterior panels</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>The building is outside FEMA 500-year designated flood zone
All phones in the building feature a fist shaped key configured as a Chuck Norris speed dial button.

<a rel="attachment wp-att-2946" href="http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/10/our-new-place-in-miami/nap/"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2946" title="nap" src="http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/files/2010/10/nap.jpg" alt="" width="512" height="357" /></a>

Miami has been ranked as one of the top-five best interconnected cities in the world, ahead of San Francisco, Chicago and Washington, D.C. Terremark's NAP (Network Access Point) of the Americas makes Miami the only city in the U.S. where Optical, Ethernet, MPLS, Voice and Internet traffic is handed off in a single location. The NAP of the Americas is located in downtown Miami, an area that has numerous telecommunications carrier facilities, fiber loops, international cable landings and multiple power grids.</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Semester selector</title>
		<link>http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2008/12/semester-selector/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 10 Dec 2008 03:42:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>soomotom</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://skunkworks.soomo.org/?p=36</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[One of our support issues this year was the problem of stale courses.  Apparently, it was not clear to the professorsphere that they needed to create new courses for the spring.  As a result, we had plenty of students sign up for courses that ended in December.Today we introduced a grading period data element to the construction of a course.  When creating a new course, the professor will be asked to tell us which semester and year they will be teaching.  By collecting this information, we are able to display courses in the  correct order making it easier for the student to choose the right one.<a href="http://ui.soomo.org/wp-content/uploads/2008/02/grading11.png" title="grading1.png" rel="lightbox"><img src="http://ui.soomo.org/wp-content/uploads/2008/02/grading11.png" alt="grading1.png" /></a><a href="http://ui.soomo.org/wp-content/uploads/2008/02/grading21.png" title="grading2.png" rel="lightbox"><img src="http://ui.soomo.org/wp-content/uploads/2008/02/grading21.png" alt="grading2.png" /></a><a href="http://ui.soomo.org/wp-content/uploads/2008/02/grading31.png" title="grading3.png" rel="lightbox"><img src="http://ui.soomo.org/wp-content/uploads/2008/02/grading31.png" alt="grading3.png" /></a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Bio Bites</title>
		<link>http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/11/bio-bites/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 30 Nov 2010 22:32:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>rebeccasmithshelley</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/?p=2958</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[During a recent iteration of sp.com, we dreamed up a biographical questionnaire for the About Us page. The site is still evolving, but in the meantime we're using this venue to post some fun facts for our mutual reading pleasure. As you can see, Soomo's not only a great-looking group but we're fascinating, too. Somebody should really take us out for dinner.

A few of you didn't get to respond - if that's you, feel free to share some factoids in a comment.

TOM

<strong>What do you do for fun?</strong>
Almost anything that requires hearing protection or a helmet. Double points if both are required.

<strong>Where did you grow up? </strong>
Jersey, got a problem with that?

<strong>If you could time travel, what point in history would you visit (and why)?</strong>
I would go to tomorrow and hid a $10 bill in tomorrows jeans cause that would be awesome!

FRITZ

<strong>What's something extraordinary or unusual about you?</strong>
Once a year, I compete in the longest freshwater sailing race in the world.

<strong>What profession (other than working at Soomo) would you most like to do?</strong>
Gentleman Farmer

<strong>What's the most interesting place you've ever been? </strong>
The receiving end of a sucker-punch! You learn a lot about yourself at that moment, no matter where you are.

SUSAN

<strong>What's the most interesting place you've ever been? </strong>
Moscow and Prague when they were still behind the Iron Curtain; having the guard lift me over the barrier so I could see the changing of the guard at Lenin's Tomb.

<strong>What profession (other than working at Soomo) would you most like to do? </strong>
Sign Language Interpreter

<strong>What part of the world would you most like to visit? </strong>
It changes constantly, but currently I'd love to go to Australia

MAUREEN

<strong>What's something extraordinary or unusual about you?</strong>
My uncle is God (I have two nun aunts)

<strong>If you could go back to college, what would you major in?</strong>
Pirateology

<strong>What Muppet would you be?</strong>
The Great Gonzo

MATT

<strong>Where did you grow up? </strong>
Germany, Georgia/South Carolina

<strong>What superpower would you most like to have? </strong>
Healing

<strong>What do you do for fun?</strong>
Watch soccer, read books, converse around a cup of coffee or glass of wine

REBECCA

<strong>What's one item from your bucket list?</strong>
See Sigur Ros and the aurora borealis on the same night. In Iceland.

<strong>Do you have any party tricks?</strong>
When I throw parties I almost always make boiled peanuts.

<strong>What's the most interesting place you've ever been?</strong>
Living with rednecks in rural France was pretty interesting. Yes, there are French rednecks.

KEVIN

<strong>Where did you grow up? </strong>
Mountains of Alaska

<strong>What do you do for fun?</strong>
Failed competitive skier, successful reader

<strong>If you could go back to college, what would you major in?</strong>
I did! Majored in ed tech.

ZARA

<strong>What part of the world would you most like to visit?</strong>
Africa, no question about it. Eastern Africa to get specific.

<strong>Who would play you in a movie of your life?</strong>
Does Chuck Norris have a twin sister?

<strong>What's something extraordinary or unusual about you?</strong>
Hmm. Finger tattoos? I have never seen ET the movie? I am allergic to the only nut that Soomo stocks in the pantry?

JACOB

<strong>What's something extraordinary or unusual about you?</strong>
I was living in New York on 9/11 and watched the destruction of the WTC from my rooftop in Brooklyn.

<strong>What profession (other than working at Soomo) would you most like to do?</strong>
Musician

<strong>What do you do for fun?</strong>
Sit on the porch, drink beer, and play the guitar (That's my inner hillbilly, I guess. Or inner hippie. Or is it hipbilly?)

NANCY

<strong>What's something extraordinary or unusual about you? </strong>
I have 1 kneecap and 6 tattoos.

<strong>What's your dream car? </strong>
1965 Cherry Red Mustang Convertible with White Leather Interior

<strong>What's one item from your bucket list? </strong>
Taking the Trans-Canadian train to Alaska, then the Trans-American train to Washington.

PAIGE

<strong>What do you do for fun? </strong>
My interests include dyeing my hair, reading books, harassing my husband, eating, and pirates.

<strong>Do you have any party tricks? </strong>
I can karaoke all of Total Eclipse of the Heart without passing out.

<strong>What part of the world would you most like to visit? </strong>
Dollywood!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Malformed HTML now wellformed HTML!</title>
		<link>http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/12/malformed-html-now-wellformed-html/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 06 Dec 2010 17:13:02 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/?p=2969</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Turns out that the template for AG/CG/IR, the code that lays out the TOC page was pretty seriously goofed. It was handled discretely by most browsers, but Firefox was kind enough to break and show us our flaw. It created weird spots of color and unclickability.

Upon detailed inspection of these errors, Matt found that the page was built with block tags within inline tags. I know - you're yelling at your browser saying - Thats valid in HTML 5! Well, since 5 is not standardized yet, we have to remain backwards compatible.

Fixed code is up and all is well once again.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>2969</wp:post_id>

		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>

	<item>
		<title>Making the most of WordPress</title>
		<link>http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/12/making-the-most-of-wordpress/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 16 Dec 2010 17:05:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/?p=2971</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Once upon a time, there was a massive effort to move Soomopublishing.com to WordPress. The upside was obvious - self editing of our pages and content. But the downside was overwhelming - it takes a lot of time and talent to make a new site happen.

Once again, Matt has built us a bridge to the future. Some server side <a rel="attachment wp-att-2973" href="http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/12/making-the-most-of-wordpress/custom-%e2%80%b9-fresh-soomo-publishing/"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2973" title="Custom  Fresh Soomo Publishing" src="http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/files/2010/12/Custom--Fresh-Soomo-Publishing.jpg" alt="" width="544" height="426" /></a>trickery and we can now access pages on WordPress from our existing SP.com site. Check out http://soomopublishing.com/wp/custom. The page is on Wordpress, but the url says soomopublishing.com - so fantastic, I bet nobody notices.]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Robots can&#039;t log in</title>
		<link>http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/12/robots-cant-log-in/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Dec 2010 15:20:26 +0000</pubDate>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/?p=2994</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[With thesupposition that robots can't log into our site, our anti robot defenses should be lowered for logged in users - because logged in means you are a user, not a robot. Whelp, here we go - our support page is now presented in the wild with the prove you are a human quiz.

<a rel="attachment wp-att-2995" href="http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/12/robots-cant-log-in/wild/"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-2995" title="wild" src="http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/files/2010/12/wild.jpg" alt="" width="420" height="577" /></a>

		<title>Obscurity via Java</title>
		<link>http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/12/obscurity-via-java/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Dec 2010 15:55:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/?p=3009</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Spammers love it when people put email addresses on their websites. Since we are generally against spam, Matt replaced our mail to links with some tidy java script. The end result is the same - click to email us, but the actual email address is opaque. Take that spam senders!

<a rel="attachment wp-att-3011" href="http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2010/12/obscurity-via-java/who-1/"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-3011" title="who-1" src="http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/files/2010/12/who-1.jpg" alt="" width="417" height="312" /></a>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Buying a copy of history, which turns out to be an American Government book...</title>
		<link>http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2011/01/buying-a-copy-of-history-which-turns-out-to-be-an-american-government-book/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 07 Jan 2011 20:24:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/?p=3040</guid>
		<description></description>

	<item>
		<title>Behind the scenes at Lulu</title>
		<link>http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2011/01/behind-the-scenes-at-lulu/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 07 Jan 2011 20:34:14 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/?p=3048</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This tasty line of code is what uploads our Lulu book orders to their website for purchase. Every day at ten after one in the morning, the previous days orders are posted.

# (Cron version V5.0 -- $Id: crontab.c,v 1.12 2004/01/23 18:56:42 vixie Exp $)

# Puppet Name: periodic_puppet_run

PATH=/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/bin

10 9 * * * /engineyard/bin/puppet_run.sh

<span style="color: #ff0000;"># Upload orders to Lulu.com every morning at 1:10am</span>

<span style="color: #ff0000;"> </span><span style="color: #ff0000;">10 1 * * * /data/soomo/current/script/runner 'UploadPendingLuluBooks.new.perform'</span>
<div></div>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>AZC mentor chat button</title>
		<link>http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2011/03/azc-mentor-chat-button/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 07 Mar 2011 15:46:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/?p=3098</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The folks at WGU liked the idea of students being able to chat it up with the course mentor from the assignment page. When the student clicks the button, the logged in course mentor gets an instant message pop up. Chatting ensues. If the mentor is not online, the chat question is delivered via email. Crisp.

&nbsp;

<a rel="attachment wp-att-3100" href="http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2011/03/azc-mentor-chat-button/wgu-civics-azc_ucc-wgu-civics-editor-ch-3_-the-federal-government-3-2_-the-three-branches-1/"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-3100" title="WGU Civics (AZC_UCC) - WGU Civics Editor &gt; Ch. 3_ The Federal Government &gt; 3.2_ The Three Branches-1" src="http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/files/2011/03/WGU-Civics-AZC_UCC-WGU-Civics-Editor-Ch.-3_-The-Federal-Government-3.2_-The-Three-Branches-1.jpg" alt="" width="600" height="597" /></a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Twine.com - Basecamp with tagging?</title>
		<link>http://backstage.soomopublishing.com/2008/12/twine-com-basecamp-with-tagging/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 10 Dec 2008 03:42:02 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>soomotom</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ui.soomo.org/?p=193</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
